column4: Does anyone here happen to know why flashplugin-nonfree with Flash 9.0.115 was removed?
I see that it was pulled from the repository by Martin Pitt, but the reason given was (broken SRU)... not sure what that stands for.
Isn't the limit 3.3 or something like that with 32-bit, or is that Windows only?
What's the reason for sticking to 32 anyway?
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/CommonQuestions#head-ff0a19a9ff23537e36b3cf9d40b2d8747bd45cd4
What HW?
this pastebin has all alot of details about my issue -> http://www.pastebin.org/13242
Interesting.
Assuming you haven't tried going with a PAE kernel
how exactly would I do that? what are any pitfalls of such a kernel?
No idea, I just generally listen to the kernel messages if they tell me to try something. :
well I saw that , but I am not using more than 4GB so I didnt think it applied.
The fact that it mentioned it is interesting, though... I'm not sure what causes it to print that message.
Mine does not bitch about that, but I only have 1024MB
Similar, but below 4GB also: http://linux.derkeiler.com/Mailing-Lists/Kernel/2003-07/0995.html
aha http://osdir.com/ml/admin.managers/2005-07/msg00005.html
so I guess I need to make a custom kernel now. well that should be fun.
wonder if the 'server' ubuntu kernel has this PAE enabled?
Someone said that earlier.
http://osdir.com/ml/admin.managers/2005-07/msg00005.html
Discussion of what's different.
I'm out, but good luck.
thanks.
